tasks.name: abil
tasks.description: Grants ability points to all actions (abilities) from all selectable classes in the game. Iterates through each selectable class and modifies the player's actor value for each action in that class by the specified amount (default 9 points if not specified).

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The number of ability points to grant for each action. Defaults to 9 if not provided or if less than 1 element in the floats array.

tasks.name: action
tasks.description: Executes a game action at a specified location or on a specified actor. If only one string is provided, casts the action on the task's actor at their position. If two strings are provided, the second string specifies which actor should use the action. The action can be executed at a specific tile coordinate if provided, otherwise uses the actor's current position.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the action to execute

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of the actor who should perform the action. If empty or actor doesn't exist, uses the task's actorID or specified tile coordinate

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the action should be executed. If not provided and no valid actor in strings[1], uses the task actor's position

tasks.name: actionOnPartyNumActor
tasks.description: Executes a specified action on a party member at a specific index position. The action is cast at the party member's current position, targeting that same position. Only executes if the party has enough members to include the specified index.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the action to execute on the party member

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The zero-based index of the party member in the partyActors list to target with the action

tasks.name: add50gp
tasks.description: Adds exactly 50 gold pieces to the player's money. This is a simple, fixed-value money addition with no parameters.

tasks.name: addgp
tasks.description: Adds gold pieces to the player's money. Can either use a formula string to calculate the amount dynamically, or use a fixed float value. The formula is evaluated using the player actor as context and the result is floored to an integer.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: A formula string to calculate the amount of gold to add. Takes precedence over floats[0] if both are provided. The formula is evaluated with the player actor as the target.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: A fixed amount of gold to add. Only used if strings[0] is not provided or the strings array is empty.

tasks.name: addIconToCurrentLocation
tasks.description: Adds a tooltip icon to the player's current location. This icon will be displayed in the location's tooltip when viewing it on the map or in location interfaces.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID or name of the icon to add to the current location's tooltipIcons list

tasks.name: addItem
tasks.description: Adds an item to the game world, an actor's inventory, or the player's cargo/stash. The item can be placed at a specific tile coordinate, given to a specified actor, or added to the task's actor. Cargo items go to cargo inventory, other items go to actor inventory or stash. Handles overflow by dropping items on the ground. For actors, only adds the quantity needed if they already have some of the item.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The item type ID to create and add

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of the item to add.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Used when adding item at a tile coordinate - if true, forces the item to fit at that location

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of a specific actor to give the item to. If provided and the actor exists, the item is equipped to that actor instead of using default behavior

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the item should be placed. If provided, overrides all other placement logic and drops the item at this location

tasks.name: addItemToContainer
tasks.description: Adds an item to a container at a specific tile coordinate. Searches all items at the specified tile for a container item, optionally filtering by a specific container item ID. The item is only added if the container can fit it.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The item type ID to create and add to the container

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of the item to add to the container.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The specific container item ID to add items to. If empty or not provided, uses the first available container at the tile that can fit the item

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the container is located. Required for this task to do anything - task does nothing if not provided

tasks.name: addJournalGoal
tasks.description: Adds a goal to the player's journal by storing it in global variables goal0-goal19. Concatenates all string parameters with commas to form the complete goal text. Checks if the goal already exists or finds an empty slot. When successfully added, refreshes the journal UI, makes it visible, and plays visual and sound effects.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The primary goal text or first part of the goal. Additional strings are appended with commas to form the complete goal

optional.name: strings[1+]
optional.description: Additional parts of the goal text. All non-empty strings from index 1 onward are concatenated to strings[0] with comma separators to build the full goal text

tasks.name: addLocationUnlockable
tasks.description: Adds an unlockable item or feature to the current location with a specified cost. After adding the unlockable, attempts to immediately unlock items at the location without displaying the unlock notification. Used for adding purchasable upgrades or features to locations.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID or identifier of the unlockable to add to the current location

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The cost required to unlock this feature (typically in gold)

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Additional parameter for the unlockable (purpose depends on the specific unlockable type)

tasks.name: addTalkerToParty
tasks.description: Adds the task's actor to the player's party as an ally and to the fleet. If the actorID starts with 'hire_', changes the ID to 'hired_' with a unique suffix and forces addition to landing party. Optionally can force addition to landing party via bool parameter. Reduces crew morale by 1 if it's above 70.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, attempts to add the actor to the landing party in addition to the main party and fleet

tasks.name: addTalkerToParty_temp
tasks.description: Adds the task's actor to the party as a temporary companion with restricted permissions (cannot edit appearance, loot corpses, or be fully controlled). Copies the player's cloth palette to the actor. Refreshes their actions and in difficulty mode, ensures they have appropriate support abilities for their actor type and class, and may boost ability ranks by 1 point each.

tasks.name: addToFleet_andSwapWithFleet_slot
tasks.description: Swaps the task's actor (a boat) with a boat at a specific fleet slot index. The fleet boat is removed from the fleet, its crew transferred to the task's actor, then the task's actor joins the fleet with that crew. The displaced boat is placed near travel_point9 in the zone with its dialog set to 'boat_unmoor' and made uncontrollable. The new boat maintains its position in the fleet order.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The zero-based index of the boat in the player's fleet to swap with the task's actor

tasks.name: addToFleet
tasks.description: Adds the task's actor (typically a boat) to the player's fleet. If the actor's dialog is 'boat_unmoor', clears it. Adds the actor to the party and then removes them from the zone without removing from party, effectively moving them to the fleet.

tasks.name: addToParty
tasks.description: Adds a specified actor to the player's party. Returns false if the actor doesn't exist in the zone, preventing further task execution. Simple party addition without fleet or landing party modifications.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to add to the party

tasks.name: addTreasuresToZone
tasks.description: Spawns a shipwreck treasure at coordinates stored in global variables 'treasureTCX' and 'treasureTCY'. Only executes if treasureTCX is non-zero. Creates a buried shipwreck container with random gold (90-220), cargo_lost, two random loot items (loot3 and loot4), and lost_docs. Clears the treasure coordinate global variables after spawning.

tasks.name: addTrigger
tasks.description: Adds a global trigger to the current zone if it exists in the global triggers data and isn't already present in the zone. Creates a new trigger instance from the global trigger definition and assigns it an unused trigger number in the zone.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the global trigger to add to the current zone

tasks.name: addZoneFX
tasks.description: Adds a visual or special effect to the current zone. Can optionally check if the effect already exists and skip adding if it does. Uses optional tile coordinates and float parameter for effect positioning or magnitude.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the zone effect to add

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A parameter for the zone effect (could be duration, intensity, or other effect-specific value)

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, only adds the effect if it doesn't already exist in the zone's zoneFX list. If false, adds regardless of existing effects

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Optional tile coordinates for positioning the zone effect. The X and Y values are passed to addZoneFX

tasks.name: adjustFleetAlliegances
tasks.description: Converts enemy fleet escorts (actors with combat label 'E') from the same faction as the enemy fleet into hostile enemies. Only executes if an enemy fleet exists. Clears the playerEscort global variable, changes their combat label color to enemy fleet color, makes them hostile, and displays red exclamation marks above them.

tasks.name: advanceTimers
tasks.description: Advances all game timers by a specified amount. This affects time-based systems and events in the zone. Uses the same float value for both parameters of advanceToNextTimer.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount of time to advance all timers by

tasks.name: allc
tasks.description: Unlocks all selectable character classes in the game. For each class, sets its unlock global variable (either from the class's formula requirement or 'class_<classID>'), adds it to known classes list, enables the unlockAllClasses flag, and refreshes the class info UI. Useful for debugging or cheat modes.

tasks.name: allclass
tasks.description: Unlocks all selectable character classes in the game. For each class, sets its unlock global variable (either from the class's formula requirement or 'class_<classID>'), adds it to known classes list, enables the unlockAllClasses flag, and refreshes the class info UI. Identical to 'allc' task.

tasks.name: allxp
tasks.description: Awards experience points to all party members for all selectable classes. Each party member receives the specified XP amount (default 9999) for every selectable class in the game. Useful for rapidly leveling up the entire party across all classes.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The amount of XP to award for each class to each party member. Defaults to 9999 if not provided

tasks.name: animate
tasks.description: Plays an animation on an actor and optionally makes them busy for a duration. Can target either the task's actor or a specified actor. If a busy timer is provided, removes stun effects and sets the actor's busy timer to prevent other actions.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the animation to play on the actor

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The busy timer duration. If greater than 0, removes stun effects and prevents the actor from taking other actions for this duration

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of the actor to animate. If provided and non-empty, overrides using the task's actorID

tasks.name: anim
tasks.description: Plays an animation on the player character, clears any debug draw strings, and switches the game mode to travel. Displays an error if no animation name is provided. Simpler than 'animate' task - always targets the player and doesn't support busy timers.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The name of the animation to play on the player. Shows error message if not provided

tasks.name: appendToGlobalVar
tasks.description: Appends a calculated value to a global variable string. Evaluates a formula and appends the result to the existing string value of the specified global variable. The formula result is converted to a string for concatenation.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to append to

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: A formula string to calculate the value to append. The formula result is converted to string and concatenated to the global variable's current string value

tasks.name: appendToGlobalVar_locID
tasks.description: Appends the current location's ID to a global variable string. Only executes if the player is currently at a location. The location ID is concatenated to the global variable's existing string value.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to append the current location ID to

tasks.name: appendToGlobalVar_math
tasks.description: Appends a calculated value to a global variable string. Evaluates a formula and appends the result to the existing string value of the specified global variable. Identical to 'appendToGlobalVar' task.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to append to

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: A formula string to calculate the value to append. The formula result is converted to string and concatenated to the global variable's current string value

tasks.name: appendToGlobalVar_string
tasks.description: Appends a literal string value to a global variable string. No formula evaluation - directly concatenates the provided string to the global variable's existing string value.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to append to

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The literal string value to append to the global variable

tasks.name: appendToGlobalVar_zoneID
tasks.description: Appends the current zone's ID to a global variable string. The zone ID is concatenated to the global variable's existing string value.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to append the current zone ID to

tasks.name: applyElement
tasks.description: Applies an elemental reaction to a single tile. The element type is converted from the string name and applied to the specified tile coordinate, triggering any elemental interactions on that tile.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the element to apply to the tile (e.g., 'fire', 'water', 'ice', etc.)

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The tile coordinate where the element should be applied

tasks.name: applyElementToArea
tasks.description: Applies an elemental reaction to a rectangular area of tiles. Iterates through all tiles in the area defined by the starting coordinate and size, applying the element to each. Optionally increments a delay value for each tile to create staggered effects.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the element to apply to each tile in the area

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The size of the rectangular area as a TileCoord string (e.g., '5,5' for a 5x5 area)

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The top-left corner coordinate of the rectangular area to apply the element to

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: An increment value added to the delay for each tile processed, creating a cascading or staggered element application effect

tasks.name: applyElementToZone
tasks.description: Applies an elemental reaction to the entire zone using the fast zone-wide element application method. Can optionally pass a boolean parameter to the reaction function for additional behavior control.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the element to apply to the entire zone

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: An optional boolean parameter passed to the reactZoneWithElement_fast function, controlling some aspect of the element application behavior

tasks.name: askForNewPortName
tasks.description: Opens a text input dialog asking the player to name a port. Switches to travel mode, displays a confirmation window with text input enabled asking 'What will you name the port?', and triggers the 'renamePort' special effect when confirmed. The dialog cannot be closed by the player and clears on turn start.

tasks.name: attractAttention
tasks.description: Attracts the attention of nearby actors to a location, making them investigate or become alert. If tile coordinates are provided, uses that location with optional custom distance and affects-all-actors flag. If no coordinates, uses the task actor's position. Default distance is 12 tiles.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate to attract attention to. If not provided, uses the task actor's position

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The distance radius for attention attraction. Defaults to 12 if not provided or zero

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, affects all actors always regardless of their state. If false or not provided, uses default behavior

tasks.name: attractAttentionToPlayer
tasks.description: Attracts the attention of nearby actors to the player's current position, making them investigate or become alert. Uses the player's position as both source and target of attention. Default distance is 12 tiles but can be customized.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The distance radius for attention attraction centered on the player. Defaults to 12 if not provided or zero

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, affects all actors always regardless of their state. If false or not provided, uses default behavior

tasks.name: autobuy_food
tasks.description: Automatically purchases food to fill cargo space or spend all available money, whichever is less. Calculates how much food can be bought based on cargo space and available money, deducts the cost, and adds the food to cargo inventory. Uses current food buy price.

tasks.name: autosaveASAP
tasks.description: Flags the game to perform an autosave as soon as possible. Sets the ZoneManager's autosaveASAP flag to true, which will trigger an autosave on the next appropriate opportunity.

tasks.name: barracksLineup
tasks.description: Arranges all party actors (both active party and barracks) in a grid formation at a specified location. Places actors in rows with configurable spacing, facing right (90 degrees). Active party members are positioned slightly higher. Actors not already in the zone are added. Default spacing is 1 tile, arranged in a 7-wide grid with 4-tile vertical spacing.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The horizontal spacing between actors in the lineup. Defaults to 1 if set to 0 or less. Controls how spread out the grid is

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The top-left corner position where the lineup grid starts

tasks.name: bezoar_setupportselect
tasks.description: Dynamically populates a dialog node with teleport options to discovered ports in a specific quadrant of the Eral region. Uses directional coordinates to filter ports by quadrant (e.g., +1,-1 for northeast). Each option teleports to the port and sets a global variable. Excludes port26 and the current location. Adjusts dialog window size based on number of options.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID to populate with port teleport options

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The X direction filter for port selection: -1 for west, 0 for center, +1 for east relative to overworld center

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: The Y direction filter for port selection: -1 for north, 0 for center, +1 for south relative to overworld center

tasks.name: bighead
tasks.description: Toggles big head mode on and off, making character heads appear larger. If no bool parameter is provided, toggles the current state. If bools[0] is true, forces big head mode to be enabled.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, forces big head mode to be enabled. If not provided, toggles the current bigHeadMode state

tasks.name: b
tasks.description: Switches the game mode to build mode, allowing the player to place structures and build. Short alias for the 'build' task.

tasks.name: boardActor
tasks.description: Initiates boarding of another actor's zone or ship. Moves the player to a boarding zone associated with the target actor. Sets a brief interaction delay to prevent immediate re-interaction.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor/ship to board

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Additional boarding parameter (likely the zone or specific boarding location identifier)

tasks.name: build
tasks.description: Switches the game mode to build mode, allowing the player to place structures and build.

tasks.name: buryAllItemsOfType
tasks.description: Buries or unburies all items of a specific type or with a specific special property across the entire zone. Iterates through every tile in the zone, finding matching items and setting their buried status. Can match by item ID or by special property. The bool parameter controls whether to bury (false) or unbury (true).

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The item type ID to bury/unbury. Items with this exact ID will be affected

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If false, buries the items (makes them hidden). If true, unburies them (makes them visible)

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: A special property name to filter items by. If provided and non-empty, also affects all items with this special property regardless of their item ID

tasks.name: buryGlobalVarItems
tasks.description: Manages visibility of items that have the 'setGlobalVarWhenConverted' special property based on corresponding global variables. Iterates through all items in the zone, and for matching items, unburies them if their global variable (named after their item ID) is greater than 0, otherwise buries them. Used for quest or progression-based item visibility.

tasks.name: buryLocations
tasks.description: Buries all location marker items for undiscovered locations in the current zone. Searches the zone's locations dictionary and for each undiscovered location, finds all items with the 'location' special property at and around that location's coordinates (center plus/minus one tile in each cardinal direction) and buries them. Only works if the current zone has locations in the game state.

tasks.name: buyFood_fillCargo
tasks.description: Purchases food to completely fill the remaining cargo space. Calculates how much cargo space is available, determines the cost to fill that space with food, and if the player has enough money, completes the purchase and adds the food to cargo inventory.

tasks.name: buyFood
tasks.description: Purchases a specific quantity of food using the item's base value for pricing. Deducts the cost from player money and adds the food to cargo inventory. Only completes the purchase if the player has enough money.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of food to purchase. Uses the last float in the array (floats.Count - 1), so this should be the only or last float provided

tasks.name: buyGoods_confirmWindow
tasks.description: Opens a confirmation window with a slider for purchasing trade goods from the current location. Uses the location's trade good item type. Sets a default quantity of 1 if the provided quantity is 0. Opens the buy slider UI for the goods.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The initial/default quantity for the purchase slider. Uses the last float in the array. If 0, automatically sets to 1

tasks.name: buyGoods
tasks.description: Purchases trade goods from the current location. Calculates the cost based on the trade good's value multiplied by the quantity, deducts money from the player, and adds the purchased goods to the cargo inventory. Only completes if the player has enough money to afford the purchase.

required.name: floats[floats.Count - 1]
required.description: Quantity of trade goods to purchase (uses last float in array)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Optional tile coordinate (stored but not used in this task)

tasks.name: buyItem_confirmWindow
tasks.description: Opens a confirmation window for purchasing an item with a quantity slider. If the item has the cargo property, opens the cargo window, otherwise opens the stash window. Defaults to quantity of 1 if floats[floats.Count - 1] is 0.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Item type ID to purchase

required.name: floats[floats.Count - 1]
required.description: Initial quantity to display in the slider (defaults to 1 if set to 0)

tasks.name: buyLocationFood
tasks.description: Purchases food from the current location's cafe for the entire crew. Deducts money based on the buy price multiplied by crew size, increases crew morale by the food's power value, applies any actor value effects from the food to boats or crew members, saves the food ID to the 'lastFoodEaten' global variable, teleports the party to travel point (0,2), and clears the party's path.

tasks.name: buyShip
tasks.description: Purchases a ship of the specified actor type. Deducts the ship's value from player money, increments the 'shipsBought' global variable, clones the actor prefab with a unique ID, sets it to non-hostile player faction, adds it to the player's fleet (creating a new fleet if none exists), and plays a success sound.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Actor type ID of the ship to purchase

tasks.name: bz
tasks.description: Debug command that lists all zone data files in the Content/Data/ZoneData/ directory that start with 'bz'. The file names are concatenated into a string, wrapped for display, and drawn as debug text on screen.

tasks.name: calc
tasks.description: Debug command that evaluates a formula string and displays the result on screen. Creates a new Formula from the provided string, calculates it using the player actor, and displays the result as debug text with the formula string as the label.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Formula string to evaluate (only used if strings.Count >= 1)

tasks.name: cameraAtPlayer
tasks.description: Points the camera at the player character's current tile coordinate position.

tasks.name: cameraAtPoint
tasks.description: Points the camera at a specific travel point and sets it to fixed camera mode. The travel point is determined by converting the two float indices into a travel point coordinate.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Travel point number (first index)

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: Travel point set number (second index)

tasks.name: cameraAtPointLock
tasks.description: Points the camera at a specific travel point, sets it to fixed camera mode, and locks the camera so it cannot be changed by setting the cameraCantBeChangedTimer to an extremely high value (999999). The travel point is determined by converting the two float indices into a travel point coordinate.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Travel point number (first index)

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: Travel point set number (second index)

tasks.name: cameraAtTalker
tasks.description: Points the camera at the current talker actor's tile coordinate position. The talker is identified by the actorID property of the task.

tasks.name: cancelIfEnemiesNotPresent
tasks.description: Cancels the task chain if no hostile enemies are present within a specified distance. Checks all actors in the zone and actors to be added. If floats[0] is 0, any enemy anywhere triggers presence. Otherwise checks distance from the reference point (talker position or tileCoords[0]). Returns false (cancels) if no enemies are found within range.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Distance in tiles to search for enemies (0 means check entire zone)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Reference point for distance checks (uses talker position if not provided)

tasks.name: cancelIfEnemiesPresent
tasks.description: Cancels the task chain if any hostile enemies are present within a specified distance. Checks all actors in the zone and actors to be added. If floats[0] is 0, any enemy anywhere triggers cancellation. Otherwise checks distance from the reference point (talker position or tileCoords[0]). Can optionally filter by specific actor type ID. Returns false (cancels) if matching enemies are found within range.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Distance in tiles to search for enemies (0 means check entire zone)

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Specific actor type ID to search for (empty string means any hostile actor)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Reference point for distance checks (uses talker position if not provided)

tasks.name: cancelIfItemNotPresent
tasks.description: Cancels the task chain if a specific item type is not present at the specified location. If tileCoords[0] is provided, checks only that tile. Otherwise searches the entire area defined by topLeftTC and btmRightTC. Returns false (cancels) if the item is not found at the specified location.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Item type ID to search for

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Specific tile coordinate to check (if not provided, searches the trigger area)

tasks.name: cancelIfItemPresent
tasks.description: Cancels the task chain if a specific item type is present at the specified location. If tileCoords[0] is provided, checks only that tile. Otherwise searches the entire area defined by topLeftTC and btmRightTC. Returns false (cancels) if the item is found at any searched location.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Item type ID to search for

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Specific tile coordinate to check (if not provided, searches the trigger area)

tasks.name: cancelIf
tasks.description: Cancels the current task chain if a formula condition is met. Evaluates the formula using the actor and optional parameters. If the result is <= 0 (false), the task continues normally. If the result is > 0 (true), the task chain is cancelled (returns false). The bool can invert the logic so cancellation occurs when the result is >= 1.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Formula string to evaluate as the condition

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Modifier value passed to the formula calculation

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, inverts the logic to cancel when result >= 1 instead of > 0

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Optional tile coordinate to pass to the formula calculation

tasks.name: cancelQuest
tasks.description: Cancels the current quest by clearing all quest-related global variables (questType, questGiver, questReward, questDest, questLog, questGoal, questRoyal, questStartNum, questCompleted, questLogImage). Also hides all monster den locations in the 'eral' region by setting them to non-discoverable and undiscovered.

tasks.name: cancelRoyalQuest
tasks.description: Cancels the current quest only if it is a royal quest (questRoyal > 0). Clears all quest-related global variables (questType, questGiver, questReward, questDest, questLog, questGoal, questRoyal, questStartNum, questCompleted, questLogImage). Also hides all monster den locations in the 'eral' region by setting them to non-discoverable and undiscovered.

tasks.name: captureShipNum
tasks.description: Captures a specific enemy or assist fleet ship by index and adds it to the player's fleet. Only works if player has fewer than 9 boats. The ship is set to non-hostile player faction, crew is cleared, cloth palette changes to 'p26', max HP is reduced by 2, the ship is renamed with a 'cap' suffix, and the 'shipsCaptured' global variable is incremented. The fleet window is refreshed to show the new addition.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Index of the ship to capture from the combined list of non-incapacitated enemy/assist fleet ships

tasks.name: captureShips_afterCombat

tasks.name: closeCharEdit

tasks.name: closeFleetWindow
tasks.description: Closes the fleet management window. Calls InputManager's close_fleetWindow method to dismiss the fleet interface.

tasks.name: createMonsterDenNearby
tasks.description: Creates a new monster den location near the current location. optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: If true, saves generated textures to desktop for debugging

tasks.name: crewMorale

tasks.name: crewxp

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Amount of experience points to award to all crew members

tasks.name: csave

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Custom save file name (defaults to 'consoleSave' if not provided)

tasks.name: cutsceneMode

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Whether to enable (true) or disable (false) cutscene mode. If not provided, defaults to enabling cutscene mode.

tasks.name: damageNumber
tasks.description: Displays a floating damage number (text popup) at the player's position with custom text and duration. The text will move upward and fade out over time.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The text to display in the damage number popup

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Additional duration in seconds added to the base 2-second display time. Total display time will be 2 + floats[0] seconds.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Additional duration in seconds added to the base 2-second display time. Total display time will be 2 + floats[0] seconds.

tasks.name: debug_drawStrings
tasks.description: Draws a debug message with a custom label and value, visible in debug mode. Only displays if both strings are provided and the first string is not empty.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The label/category for the debug message

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The value/content to display for this debug message

tasks.name: debug
tasks.description: Toggles debug mode on or off and displays the current debug mode state with a debug message.

tasks.name: debugMessage
tasks.description: Displays a debug message with either a custom label and value, or with the default 'Debug' label if only one string is provided.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The debug message value to display (or label if strings[1] is provided)

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: If provided, strings[0] becomes the label and this becomes the value to display

tasks.name: delayActions

required.name: floats[0]

tasks.name: delayDialog
tasks.description: Temporarily hides the dialog window for a specified duration, prevents player interaction during that time, then resumes the dialog automatically after the timer expires.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The duration in seconds to hide the dialog and prevent interaction before resuming

tasks.name: deleteZone

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the zone to permanently delete

tasks.name: destination

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The destination tile coordinates (X and Y) where the actor should move to

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the actor to set the destination for. If empty or actor not found, uses the task's actorID.

tasks.name: dialogEffect

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name/ID of the dialog effect to execute

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: The delay in seconds before the dialog effect executes

tasks.name: die
tasks.description: Forces the task's actor to die by making them killable and dealing massive damage. This will kill the actor regardless of their current unkillable status.

tasks.name: disableFog
tasks.description: Disables fog of war rendering for the current zone, making all areas visible regardless of exploration status.

tasks.name: disableHelpGem
tasks.description: Disables the help gem feature and sets its usability timer to -1, preventing it from becoming available again until manually re-enabled.

tasks.name: disableTrigger
tasks.description: Disables a trigger in the current zone by marking it as done, preventing it from firing again. The trigger can be identified by either its numeric ID or its string name.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric ID of the trigger to disable. This is used if strings[0] is empty or doesn't match a trigger name.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The string name/ID of the trigger to disable. If provided and a matching trigger exists, its numeric ID will be used instead of floats[0].

tasks.name: disableUI

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The tile coordinates where fog of war should be discovered/revealed

tasks.name: dm
tasks.description: Toggles debug mode on or off and displays the current debug mode state with a debug message. This is an alias for the 'debug' task.

tasks.name: dominateworld

tasks.name: donate

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount of money to donate. This value is multiplied by 0.001 to calculate favor and fame changes.

tasks.name: dropItem
tasks.description: Removes items from a specified actor's inventory and drops them on the ground at that actor's position. If no quantity is specified, defaults to dropping 1 item.

required.description: The ID of the actor whose inventory contains the item to drop

required.name: strings[1]

tasks.name: enableHelpGem

tasks.name: endBoarding

tasks.name: enemyFlee

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the first fleet's actor to participate in the battle

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of the second fleet's actor to battle against. Required if strings[0] is provided.

tasks.name: enterLocation

tasks.name: enterSellMode_cargo

tasks.name: enterSellMode_stash
