required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to play

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of an actor at whose position the effect should appear. If empty, uses task's actorID or coordinates

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinates where the effect should appear. If not provided, uses actor position or camera position

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true and tile coordinates are provided, the effect is tinted white for screen-space positioning

tasks.name: fxOnParty
tasks.description: Plays the specified visual effect at the position of every party member simultaneously. This is useful for showing party-wide buffs, debuffs, or other effects.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the visual effect to play on each party member

tasks.name: fxOnPlayerRank
tasks.description: Plays a visual effect at a specific UI location on the screen, positioned relative to the rank display in the escape menu's right info panel. The effect is tinted white for screen-space rendering.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to play at the player rank UI location

tasks.name: fxOnTalker
tasks.description: Plays a visual effect at the position of the NPC the player is currently talking to. This is useful for adding visual feedback during conversations.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the visual effect to play at the talker's position

tasks.name: gameOver
tasks.description: Triggers the game over sequence, ending the current game. This is used when the player has lost or a critical failure condition is met.

tasks.name: gc
tasks.description: Forces garbage collection to free up memory. This clears extra zones held in memory and runs the .NET garbage collector twice with finalizer waits. This is a debug/optimization command for managing memory usage.

tasks.name: getBribeAmount
tasks.description: Calculates and displays the bribe amount needed to appease enemies in combat. The amount is based on the power level of the actor's combat group (14% of their power level), and updates the first statement of the current dialog node to show this amount.

tasks.name: getItemsFromZone
tasks.description: Retrieves all items that can be picked up from another zone and spawns them at the specified tile coordinates in the current zone. The source zone is loaded temporarily, its items are extracted, and then the zone is unloaded.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the zone from which to extract items

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The tile coordinates where the extracted items should be spawned in the current zone

tasks.name: get
tasks.description: Debug command that retrieves and displays the value of a global variable, trigger flag list, or evaluates a formula. If a variable name is provided, it shows that variable's value. If no argument is given, it lists all global variables that don't start with 'D_'.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The global variable name, trigger flag key, or formula to evaluate and display. If not provided, lists all non-dialog global variables

tasks.name: getmod
tasks.description: Sets the recent mod ID reference used by the task system. This stores a Steam Workshop published file ID that can be referenced by other tasks for mod-related operations.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The Steam Workshop mod ID (as a number string) to store as the recent mod reference. If invalid or not provided, resets to 0

tasks.name: getResponse_bribe
tasks.description: Determines the NPC's response to a bribe attempt during negotiation. The response is calculated based on power levels, hostility, and the speaker's actor type, then sets the next dialog node to the appropriate response. This uses the getNegotiationResponse method with intent='bribe', myPartyPowerLevel, threatPowerLevel, hostility (from floats[last]), and speakerActorTypeID.

required.name: floats[last]
required.description: The hostility value to use in calculating the negotiation response (affects confidence and honor calculations)

tasks.name: getResponse_combat
tasks.description: Determines the NPC's response to a combat threat during negotiation. The response is calculated based on power levels, hostility, and the speaker's actor type, then sets the next dialog node to the appropriate response. This uses the getNegotiationResponse method with intent='combat', myPartyPowerLevel, threatPowerLevel, hostility (from floats[last]), and speakerActorTypeID.

required.name: floats[last]
required.description: The hostility value to use in calculating the negotiation response (affects confidence and honor calculations)

tasks.name: getResponse_peace
tasks.description: Determines the NPC's response to a peaceful negotiation attempt. The response is calculated based on power levels, hostility, and the speaker's actor type, then sets the next dialog node to the appropriate response. This uses the getNegotiationResponse method with intent='peace', myPartyPowerLevel, threatPowerLevel, hostility (from floats[last]), and speakerActorTypeID.

required.name: floats[last]
required.description: The hostility value to use in calculating the negotiation response (affects confidence and honor calculations)

tasks.name: giveActorsBaseXP
tasks.description: Awards base XP to all actors currently in the zone. This calls the awardBaseXP method on every actor, which typically grants a small amount of experience for participation.

tasks.name: giveFood
tasks.description: Adds a specified amount of food to the party's cargo inventory. Food is consumed during travel and is essential for long voyages.

required.name: floats[last]
required.description: The amount of food to add to the cargo inventory

tasks.name: giveGlobalVarGP
tasks.description: Adds gold to the player's money equal to the value stored in a specified global variable. The global variable's numeric value is converted to an integer and added to the money total.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable whose value (as an integer) should be added to the player's money

tasks.name: giveItem
tasks.description: Gives the player a specified item with a specified quantity. The item is added to the party's inventory through the standard acquisition process, which handles stacking and inventory management.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The item type ID to give to the player

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of the item to give (converted to integer)

tasks.name: giveMathXPToActorWithDialogNodeID
tasks.description: Awards calculated XP to all actors in the zone whose dialogNodeID matches the specified value. The XP amount is calculated by a formula, capped to not exceed the player's total XP, and must be non-negative. The XP is awarded without number display, party size effects, or tired state penalties.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID to match - only actors with this dialogNodeID will receive XP

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The formula string to calculate the amount of XP to award (evaluated as a numeric expression)

tasks.name: giveQuestItemReward
tasks.description: Gives the player gold based on the value of a quest item stored in the global variable 'tavern_questItem'. The item's value is added to the player's money and tracked in the 'earnedCashTotal' global variable.

tasks.name: giveShip
tasks.description: Grants the player a new ship by cloning an actor prefab and adding it to the player's fleet. The ship is made non-hostile, controllable, and assigned to the player faction. If the player has no fleet, a new fleet is initialized with this ship. The 'shipBoons' global variable is incremented to track ships received. A positive sound effect plays when the ship is granted.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The actor type ID of the ship to clone and give to the player (must be a boat-type actor)

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The unique ID to assign to the new ship. If not provided, generates an ID based on the ship type and shipBoons counter

tasks.name: gm
tasks.description: Activates god mode for the player, massively boosting their stats. Sets HP and MP to 999, Physical and Magical Defense to 99, and grants rank 9 in all actions from all selectable classes. This is a debug/cheat command for testing or invincibility.

tasks.name: gob
tasks.description: Travels to a specified zone in build mode for level editing. If coordinates are provided, the player spawns at those coordinates; otherwise spawns at a default location. This is a debug command that sets flags to enter build mode upon zone entry. Zone names containing backslashes are rejected.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The zone ID to travel to. Must not contain backslashes

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The X coordinate where the player should spawn in the zone

optional.name: floats[1]
optional.description: The Y coordinate where the player should spawn in the zone

tasks.name: godmode
tasks.description: Activates god mode for the player, massively boosting their stats. Sets HP and MP to 999, Physical and Magical Defense to 99, and grants rank 9 in all actions from all selectable classes. This is a debug/cheat command for testing or invincibility.

tasks.name: go
tasks.description: Travels to a specified zone via the console. If coordinates are provided, the player spawns at those coordinates; otherwise spawns at a default location. This is a debug command for quick zone travel. Zone names containing backslashes are rejected.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The zone ID to travel to. Must not contain backslashes

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The X coordinate where the player should spawn in the zone

optional.name: floats[1]
optional.description: The Y coordinate where the player should spawn in the zone

tasks.name: gotoIf
tasks.description: Conditionally jumps to a specified dialog node if a formula evaluates to 1 or greater. The formula is evaluated with the task's actor as the target, and if the condition is met, the dialog immediately changes to the target node.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID to jump to if the condition is true

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The formula to evaluate - if the result is >= 1, the dialog jumps to the target node

tasks.name: gotoNodeDelay
tasks.description: Jumps to a specified dialog node after a delay. The delay prevents player interaction during the wait period, then triggers the dialog change via a timer. This is useful for creating timed transitions or pauses in conversations.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID to jump to after the delay

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The delay in seconds before jumping to the target dialog node

tasks.name: goToNodeID_plus_GlobalVar
tasks.description: Jumps to a dialog node whose ID is constructed by concatenating the current dialog node ID with the value of a global variable. For example, if currentDialogNodeID is 'node' and the global variable 'node' has value '5', it jumps to 'node5'. This allows dynamic dialog branching based on global state.

tasks.name: gotoNodeIf
tasks.description: Conditionally jumps to a specified dialog node if a formula evaluates to 1 or greater. The formula is evaluated with the task's actor as the target, and if the condition is met, the dialog immediately changes to the target node.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID to jump to if the condition is true

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The formula to evaluate - if the result is >= 1, the dialog jumps to the target node

tasks.name: gp
tasks.description: Adds gold to the player's money. If no amount is specified, adds 500 gold by default. This is a debug/cheat command for quick money.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The amount of gold to add to the player's money. Defaults to 500 if not provided

tasks.name: grantXPShare_5percent
tasks.description: Distributes 5% of all accumulated class XP to all party members and barracked crew members if the XPShare global variable is enabled. For each class that has over 100 XP accumulated, each party/barracks member receives 5% of that XP in that class. The XP is awarded without visual numbers, unaffected by party size, and ignores tired state. This implements the shared experience mechanic.

tasks.name: handleDeaths
tasks.description: Processes actors who are dying by converting their 'dying' status to 'dead' once the dying duration expires. For controllable actors (party members), it queues a death cutscene with proper timing delays. For non-controllable actors (enemies), it immediately applies the 'dead' status and plays death visual effects (dust and smoke). Only processes actors if no death timer is currently active.

tasks.name: handleTiredStates
tasks.description: Manages the tired state for the party after combat or events. All active party members are fully healed (HP/MP restored) but given the 'tired' status effect. Barracks members are fully healed with max HP restoration based on the 'valueThisRun' global variable (currently always restores max HP due to 'true' condition).

tasks.name: healfaction
tasks.description: Fully heals all actors in the current zone that belong to a specified faction. The heal restores HP to full but does not restore maximum HP (injured state remains if applicable).

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The faction ID to heal (e.g., 'player', 'empire', 'guild')

tasks.name: heal
tasks.description: Heals an actor by a specified amount or fully heals the entire party. If no amount is provided, fully heals all party members. If amount is 0, it's treated as 9999 (effectively a full heal). Can target a specific actor by ID or use the task's actor.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The amount of HP to restore. If 0, treats as 9999. If not provided, fully heals the entire party instead

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the actor to heal. If empty or not provided, heals the task's actor (or full party if no float provided)

tasks.name: healparty
tasks.description: Fully heals all party members. This restores all party actors to full health.

tasks.name: help
tasks.description: Displays console command help information. If no command name is provided, lists all available console commands. If a command name is provided, shows detailed help for that specific command.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The name of the console command to get help for (e.g., 'heal', 'kill'). If not provided, lists all available commands

tasks.name: hideEscWindows
tasks.description: Hides the escape menu windows including the main menu, left info panel, and right info panel. This clears the UI for cinematic or dialog sequences.

tasks.name: hidemapicon
tasks.description: Hides all map location icons in the 'eral' (overworld) zone by marking all locations as undiscovered. Only affects locations in the current zone. This is identical to 'hidemapicons'.

tasks.name: hidemapicons
tasks.description: Hides all map location icons in the 'eral' (overworld) zone by marking all locations as undiscovered. Only affects locations in the current zone. This is identical to 'hidemapicon'.

tasks.name: hideparty
tasks.description: Permanently hides all party members by setting their invisible timer to a very high value (99999) and making them not visible. This is identical to 'hidep'.

tasks.name: hideParty
tasks.description: Temporarily hides all party members by setting their invisible timer to a specified duration. The party will reappear after the timer expires.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The duration in seconds to keep the party invisible

tasks.name: hidep
tasks.description: Permanently hides all party members by setting their invisible timer to a very high value (99999) and making them not visible. This is identical to 'hideparty'.

tasks.name: hideQuickslots
tasks.description: Shows the quickslots UI by setting hideQuickslots to false. Despite the name, this actually makes quickslots visible rather than hiding them.

tasks.name: h
tasks.description: Displays help information for console commands. If no command name is provided, lists all available commands. If a command name is provided, shows the description for that specific command from the console command descriptions registry.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The name of the console command to get help about. If not provided, lists all available commands

tasks.name: hostile
tasks.description: Marks the task's actor as hostile, making them aggressive and able to attack. This affects the actor specified by the task's actorID.

tasks.name: howmanyitems
tasks.description: Counts the number of items in the current zone and displays the count. If an item type ID is provided, counts only that type; otherwise counts all items on all tiles.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The item type ID to count. If not provided, counts all items in the zone

tasks.name: howmany
tasks.description: Counts the number of items or actors in the current zone and displays the count. If an item or actor type ID is provided, counts only that type; otherwise counts all items. Also counts actors matching the specified actor type ID.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The item type ID or actor type ID to count. If not provided, counts all items in the zone

tasks.name: howmanyWorld
tasks.description: Searches all zone data files in the world for occurrences of a specified text pattern and displays counts per zone plus a total. If no pattern is provided, attempts to use the item or actor under the mouse cursor. This is a debugging tool for finding object usage across the entire game world.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The text pattern to search for in zone files (e.g., 'actorTypeID=foo' or 'Item] ID=bar'). If not provided, uses the item or actor under the mouse cursor

tasks.name: incDefaultNode
tasks.description: Increments the default dialog node ID of the task's actor. This changes the actor's dialogNodeID to the next sequential value (e.g., 'node1' becomes 'node2'), advancing their default conversation state.

tasks.name: incOnNewDay
tasks.description: Increments the actor's dialog node and changes to that new node, but only if at least 24 hours have passed since the last time this was executed. Uses a global variable to track the last execution time. The new dialog node priority is specified by the last float in the floats array.

required.name: floats[floats.Count-1]
required.description: The priority value for the new dialog node when changing to it

tasks.name: initWaypoints
tasks.description: Forces a refresh of the AI waypoint system for the current zone. This recalculates pathfinding waypoints, useful after modifying the zone layout or blocking/unblocking areas.

tasks.name: investigator_fleetpos
tasks.description: Sets up the investigator's response for revealing fleet positions of a specified faction. If the faction is valid, enables tracking of that faction's fleets on the map for 30 days. Stores the response in a global variable for the investigator dialog system.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The faction ID whose fleet movements should be revealed and tracked

tasks.name: investigator_nearestLoc
tasks.description: Finds the nearest undiscovered location (excluding monster dens) to the current location and stores the result in a global variable for the investigator dialog system. Provides the location name and coordinates, or indicates if all locations are already discovered.

tasks.name: investigator_setoportselect
tasks.description: Generates dialog options for the investigator showing ports in a specified quadrant of the map that have unlockable items based on wealth investment. Creates dialog options listing what items can be unlocked at each port, dynamically building the menu based on the ports that match the quadrant and have investable unlocks.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID to populate with the generated port options

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The X direction sign for the quadrant (-1 for west, 1 for east)

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: The Y direction sign for the quadrant (-1 for north, 1 for south)

tasks.name: investigator_slainenemy
tasks.description: Finds an actor type that the player has killed but hasn't learned the journal entry for, then adds that journal entry to the player's knowledge. Stores the result in a global variable for the investigator dialog system, indicating success or that all possible entries are already known.

tasks.name: investigator_tradespecial
tasks.description: Reveals the next trade special (high-demand goods) location and item to the player. Refreshes the trade special system if needed while preserving the current one, then stores information about the upcoming special trade opportunity in a global variable for the investigator dialog.

tasks.name: invest
tasks.description: Invests gold at the current location, increasing favor with the player's faction and potentially changing the location's controlling faction. Also affects faction favor, increases location wealth level, and modifies fame values for trade and piracy. If the location changes faction, triggers a special event.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount of gold to invest at the location

tasks.name: jobDialogOptions
tasks.description: Dynamically generates dialog options for guild jobs at the current location. Creates dialog nodes for each available quest type (letter delivery, cargo acquisition, defeat faction, slay monsters, clear monster dens, salvage shipwrecks) with appropriate descriptions, rewards, and acceptance mechanics. Each job type has specific parameters and creates corresponding quest tracking variables.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID to populate with the generated job options

tasks.name: killall
tasks.description: Kills all non-controllable, non-invincible actors in the current zone by dealing massive damage (99999 HP). This affects all enemy actors but spares controllable party members and invincible actors.

tasks.name: killcrew
tasks.description: Kills all crew members of non-controllable actors in the current zone by dealing massive damage (99999 HP) to each crew member, then applies the 'crewless' status effect to the ship actors. This leaves enemy ships without crew but doesn't destroy the ships themselves.

tasks.name: killFaction
tasks.description: Incapacitates all actors belonging to a specified faction in the current zone. The actors are marked as incapacitated but not fully killed, putting them in a downed state.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The faction ID whose members should be incapacitated

tasks.name: kill
tasks.description: Kills all hostile, non-controllable, non-invincible actors in the current zone by dealing massive damage (99999 HP). Actors whose IDs are in the strings array are excluded from being killed. This is useful for clearing hostile enemies while preserving specific actors.

optional.name: strings
optional.description: Array of actor IDs to exclude from being killed. Any actor whose ID appears in this list will be spared

tasks.name: k
tasks.description: Displays a debug list of all actor types the player has killed, showing the actor type ID and kill count for each. The output is wrapped to fit the screen width.

tasks.name: learnJournalEntry
tasks.description: Teaches the player a journal entry and optionally displays it in the journal UI. The first bool controls whether to show an alert, and the optional second bool controls whether to animate and display the journal.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The journal entry ID to learn and display

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to show an alert when learning the journal entry

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: If false or not present, animates the journal and displays the new entry with special UI settings. If true, skips the journal display

tasks.name: listav
tasks.description: Lists all actor values (AVs) in the game or shows details for a specific AV. If an AV ID is provided, displays detailed information about that AV. Otherwise, lists all non-rank/XP actor values in a formatted grid.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The actor value ID to get detailed information about. If not provided, lists all actor values

tasks.name: listfx
tasks.description: Lists all visual/audio effects (FXs) in the game or shows details for a specific FX. If an FX ID is provided, displays detailed information about that FX. Otherwise, lists all available FX IDs.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The FX ID to get detailed information about. If not provided, lists all FX IDs

tasks.name: loadItOnUpYo
tasks.description: Loads a new zone and moves the player to the specified tile coordinate position within that zone. The two floats control camera fade timing for the zone transition.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The zone ID to load and move to

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The tile coordinate position where the player should be placed in the new zone

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The camera fade-out duration for the zone transition

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: The camera fade-in duration for the zone transition

tasks.name: loadModPageInBrowser
tasks.description: Opens the Steam Workshop page for the most recently loaded mod in the user's default web browser. This allows players to view mod details, subscribe/unsubscribe, or leave feedback.

tasks.name: loads
tasks.description: Loads a system save file by name. This is used for loading special save states, typically for debugging or specific game scenarios.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The system save file name to load

tasks.name: loadSpecialZone
tasks.description: Loads a special overlay zone at a specified screen position with optional depth, scale, and rendering settings. The position uses tile coordinates for standard positioning. The zone can be configured to only render when roofs are drawn.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The special zone ID to load and display

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The screen position (X, Y) where the special zone should be displayed

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The depth modifier for rendering the special zone

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The scale multiplier for the special zone (must be parseable as a float)

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, the special zone only draws when roofs are being rendered

tasks.name: loadSpecialZone_playerFlagship
tasks.description: Loads the player's flagship boarding zone as a special overlay at a specified screen position with optional depth, scale, and rendering settings. Automatically determines the correct boarding zone based on the player's current flagship. The position uses tile coordinates for standard positioning.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The screen position (X, Y) where the flagship zone should be displayed

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The depth modifier for rendering the special zone

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The scale multiplier for the special zone (must be parseable as a float)

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, the special zone only draws when roofs are being rendered

tasks.name: loadSpecialZone_playerFlagship_precision
tasks.description: Loads the player's flagship boarding zone as a special overlay at a precise screen position (divided by 100) with optional depth, scale, and rendering settings. Automatically determines the correct boarding zone based on the player's current flagship. The precision positioning allows for finer control than standard positioning.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The screen position (X, Y) where the flagship zone should be displayed, divided by 100 for precision positioning

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The depth modifier for rendering the special zone

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The scale multiplier for the special zone (must be parseable as a float)

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, the special zone only draws when roofs are being rendered

tasks.name: loadSpecialZone_precision
tasks.description: Loads a special overlay zone at a precise screen position (divided by 100) with optional depth, scale, and rendering settings. The precision positioning allows for finer control than standard tile coordinate positioning. The zone can be configured to only render when roofs are drawn.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The special zone ID to load and display

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The screen position (X, Y) where the special zone should be displayed, divided by 100 for precision positioning

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The depth modifier for rendering the special zone

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The scale multiplier for the special zone (must be parseable as a float)

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, the special zone only draws when roofs are being rendered

tasks.name: location_tryUnlockItems
tasks.description: Attempts to unlock items at the current location based on the location's wealth level and other criteria. This checks all potential unlockable items and makes them available if conditions are met.

tasks.name: lockCameraAt
tasks.description: Locks the camera at a specific position or actor, preventing player camera control. If a tile coordinate is provided, points the camera there with optional tracking speed and reveals fog of war. If no coordinate is given, tracks the task's actor or the current actor. The camera lock persists until released.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to fix the camera as if under a roof (affects rendering/lighting)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate to lock the camera at. If not provided, tracks an actor instead

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The camera tracking speed when moving to the position. Only used if a tile coordinate is provided and is non-zero

tasks.name: lookAtPlayer
tasks.description: Makes the task's actor turn to face the player character. Calculates the appropriate rotation based on the direction from the actor to the player and sets the actor's facing rotation. Uses delayed timers to ensure the rotation persists even if the actor is moving.

tasks.name: lookAtTalker
tasks.description: Makes the player character turn to face the task's actor (the talker in a dialog). Calculates the appropriate rotation based on the direction from the player to the actor and sets the player's facing rotation. Uses delayed timers to ensure the rotation persists even if the player is moving.

tasks.name: lootFleet_afterCombat
tasks.description: Opens the looting interface after fleet combat, allowing the player to transfer items from the defeated enemy fleet's cargo to their own. If an assist fleet is present, their cargo is first merged with the enemy fleet. The interface shows both the player's cargo and the enemy fleet's cargo with special UI settings.

tasks.name: lose10Food
tasks.description: Removes 10 food items from the player's cargo inventory. This is typically used for events, penalties, or consumption mechanics.

tasks.name: markDojoLocDone
tasks.description: Marks the current location's dojo training as complete by changing its map tooltip icon from 'sign_icon_muscle' to 'sign_icon_muscle_done'. This visually indicates that the training at this dojo has been completed.

tasks.name: markTrainerLocDone
tasks.description: Marks the current location's trainer as having completed one level of training by changing its map tooltip icon to the next stage. Handles both single and double book icons, progressing from 'sign_icon_book' to 'sign_icon_book_done' to 'sign_icon_book_done_done', and similarly for '2book' variants. This tracks multiple levels of training completion.

tasks.name: math
tasks.description: Evaluates a formula string and displays the result in the debug output. The formula is calculated using the player character as context. This is useful for testing formula expressions.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The formula string to evaluate (e.g., 'd:playerHP+10' or 'abs(-5)')

tasks.name: maximizeWindowIfTrue
tasks.description: Maximizes the game window and hides the main menu background and UI if the boolean is true. This is used for fullscreen cinematic sequences or special display modes.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, maximizes the window and hides background/UI elements

tasks.name: maximizeWindowSet
tasks.description: Sets the game window maximization state based on the boolean value. True maximizes the window, false restores it to normal size.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: True to maximize the window, false to restore to normal size

tasks.name: mergeSpecialZone
tasks.description: Merges the special zone into the current zone at a specified position. Special zones are pre-designed zone sections that can be dynamically integrated into the main zone. If a tile coordinate is provided, the special zone will be positioned at that location; otherwise, it uses the default position. This operation destroys any items that were previously in the special zone area.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The X and Y position where the special zone should be merged. If not provided, the special zone maintains its current position.

tasks.name: modFame
tasks.description: Modifies the player's fame value for a specific fame type by a given amount. Fame types track the player's reputation in different categories (such as combat, trading, etc.). Positive values increase fame, negative values decrease it.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The fame type identifier to modify (e.g., 'combat', 'trading')

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount to modify the fame value by (positive to increase, negative to decrease)

tasks.name: modGlobalVar
tasks.description: Modifies a global variable by adding or subtracting a specified amount. Global variables are persistent numeric values that can be used to track quest progress, game state, or other data across the entire game session.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to modify

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount to add to the global variable (can be negative to subtract)

tasks.name: modLocFavor
tasks.description: Modifies the player's favor (reputation) with the faction that controls the current location. This affects how NPCs in the location react to the player and what services/prices are available. Positive values increase favor, negative values decrease it.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount to modify the location's faction favor by (positive to increase, negative to decrease)

tasks.name: modLocWealthLevel
tasks.description: Modifies the wealth level of the current location. Wealth level determines the quality and availability of items for sale at the location. The value is automatically clamped between 0 and 100, and after modification, the location will attempt to unlock new items based on the new wealth level.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount to modify the location's wealth level by (positive to increase, negative to decrease). Final value is clamped between 0 and 100.

tasks.name: modNodeIDGlobalVar_1
tasks.description: Increments a global variable named after the current dialog node ID by 1. This is commonly used to track how many times a specific dialog node has been visited. The variable name is automatically set to the current dialog node's ID.

tasks.name: modNodeIDGlobalVar_999
tasks.description: Adds 999 to a global variable named after the current dialog node ID. This is typically used to mark a dialog choice as 'permanently chosen' or 'completed', with the high value (999) making it easy to check if the dialog has been visited. The variable name is automatically set to the current dialog node's ID.

tasks.name: modPlayerFactionFavor
tasks.description: Modifies favor with the faction stored in the 'playerFaction' global variable. This is used for custom player-aligned factions set during gameplay. The favor amount can be specified either as a float value or as a formula string that will be calculated.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: A formula string to calculate the favor amount. Only used if floats[0] is not provided or is 0.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The amount to modify the player faction's favor by. If 0 or not provided, uses the formula from strings[0] instead.

tasks.name: modTalkerFactionFavor
tasks.description: Modifies the player's favor with the faction that the current conversation partner (talker) belongs to. This allows dialog choices to affect reputation with the NPC's faction.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount to modify favor with the talker's faction by (positive to increase, negative to decrease)

tasks.name: modTalkerFavor
tasks.description: Modifies the player's favor with the faction that the task's actor belongs to. Only executes if the actor exists and belongs to a valid faction. This is typically used when an actor (specified by actorID) represents a faction member.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount to modify the actor's faction favor by (positive to increase, negative to decrease)

tasks.name: moveActor
tasks.description: Instantly teleports a specified actor to a new tile position and optionally sets their facing direction. The actor is moved immediately without pathfinding or animation.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to move

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The tile coordinate position to move the actor to

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The facing rotation in degrees to set for the actor after moving

tasks.name: moveActor_point
tasks.description: Moves a specified actor to the nearest travel point with specific coordinates. Travel points are designated spawn/teleport locations in a zone. The actor will be positioned at the closest travel point that matches the specified point coordinates.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to move

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The X and Y coordinates of the travel point to search for (not the exact tile position, but the travel point ID)

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The facing rotation in degrees to set for the actor after moving

tasks.name: moveAllActorsBy
tasks.description: Moves all actors in the current zone by a specified offset, keeping them within zone bounds. Also moves the camera by the same offset. Optionally sets the facing rotation for all actors. This is useful for shifting entire zone contents when merging zones or creating scene transitions.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The X and Y offset to move all actors by (relative movement, not absolute position)

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The facing rotation in degrees to set for all actors. If 0 or not provided, actor facing directions remain unchanged.

tasks.name: moveCamXY
tasks.description: Moves the camera's target position by a specified X and Y offset. The camera will smoothly pan to the new target position. This is relative movement, not absolute positioning.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The X offset to move the camera by

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: The Y offset to move the camera by

tasks.name: moveItems
tasks.description: Moves all items from a source tile coordinate to a destination tile coordinate. Items are removed from the source location and placed at the destination, forcing them to fit even if the destination would normally be full.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The destination tile coordinate where items should be moved to. The topLeftTC parameter (from task definition) specifies the source tile to remove items from.

tasks.name: moveItemsToActor
tasks.description: Transfers all items from a specified tile coordinate to an actor's inventory. The actor will attempt to equip each item, and if the inventory is full, items will be dropped on the ground near the actor. All items at the source tile are then removed.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor who should receive the items

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The tile coordinate where the items to be transferred are located

tasks.name: moveJournal
tasks.description: Animates the journal window to move to a new screen position over a specified duration. The position can be specified as absolute coordinates, right-aligned coordinates, or centered on screen based on boolean flags.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The X and Y screen position to move the journal to (in pixels)

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The duration of the movement animation in seconds

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, the X position is treated as right-aligned (distance from right edge of screen)

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: If true, the journal is centered on screen, ignoring the tileCoords position

tasks.name: movement
tasks.description: Initiates smooth movement for a specified actor toward a target tile coordinate. The actor becomes intangible during movement, and pathfinding is cleared. Movement direction is calculated relative to the actor's current position, with -1 values preserving the current coordinate on that axis. Optionally plays a 'pain' animation and sets movement speed.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The target tile coordinate to move toward. Use -1 for X or Y to maintain the actor's current position on that axis.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the actor to move. If empty string or not provided, uses the task's actorID.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, plays the 'pain' animation on the actor during movement

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The movement speed to set for the actor. If 0 or not provided, uses the actor's default speed.

tasks.name: movePartyBy
tasks.description: Moves all party members by a specified offset, keeping them within zone bounds. Also moves the camera by the same offset to keep the party in view. Optionally sets the facing rotation for all party members.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The X and Y offset to move all party members by (relative movement, not absolute position)

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The facing rotation in degrees to set for all party members. If 0 or not provided, facing directions remain unchanged.

tasks.name: movePartyTo
tasks.description: Moves the entire party to a specified tile coordinate position and centers the camera on that location. When in travel mode, prevents immediate interaction for 0.5 seconds after the move. Optionally sets the facing rotation for all party members.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The tile coordinate position to move the party to

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The facing rotation in degrees to set for all party members. If 0 or not provided, facing directions remain unchanged.

tasks.name: movePartyTo_point
tasks.description: Moves the party to the nearest travel point with specified coordinates. Travel points are designated spawn locations in a zone. Optionally spawns all player fleet boats into the zone and distributes party members across multiple travel points with the same Y coordinate.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The X and Y coordinates of the travel point to search for (travel point ID, not exact tile position)

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, distributes party members across all travel points with matching Y coordinate (X=0 to any X)

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: If true and in a boat zone, spawns all boats from the player's fleet into the zone and adds them to the party

tasks.name: moveSpecialZone
tasks.description: Initiates animated movement of the special zone to a target position. The special zone will smoothly move toward the target coordinates at a specified speed. Movement can use easing for smooth acceleration/deceleration, and can optionally yo-yo back to the starting position.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The target X and Y position for the special zone to move to (in tile coordinates)

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, uses easing (smooth acceleration/deceleration) for the movement

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The movement speed. If 0 or not provided, uses the current special zone speed.

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: If true, the special zone will yo-yo back to its starting position after reaching the target

tasks.name: moveSpecialZone_precision
tasks.description: Initiates animated movement of the special zone to a precise target position using sub-tile precision. The coordinates are divided by 100 to allow fine-grained positioning (e.g., 150 becomes 1.5 tiles). Movement can use easing for smooth acceleration/deceleration, and can optionally yo-yo back to the starting position.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The target X and Y position in centitiles (divided by 100). For example, X=150 Y=250 becomes position (1.5, 2.5).

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, uses easing (smooth acceleration/deceleration) for the movement

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The movement speed. If 0 or not provided, uses the current special zone speed.

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: If true, the special zone will yo-yo back to its starting position after reaching the target

tasks.name: moveToNewZone
tasks.description: Transitions the player and party to a different zone at a specified position. This triggers a zone change with an optional fade effect. After the transition, interaction is prevented for a brief period to allow the zone to settle.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the zone to move to

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The tile coordinate position where the party should appear in the new zone

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The fade speed for the transition effect (0 for instant, higher values for slower fade)

tasks.name: moveX1
tasks.description: Sets the task's actor to move one tile in the positive X direction (right). The actor's movement vector is set directly, causing continuous movement until stopped by collision or another movement command.

tasks.name: moveXNeg1
tasks.description: Sets the task's actor to move one tile in the negative X direction (left). The actor's movement vector is set directly, causing continuous movement until stopped by collision or another movement command.

tasks.name: moveXY
tasks.description: Sets the task's actor to move in a specified direction using custom X and Y velocity values. The movement vector is set directly, causing continuous movement in the specified direction until stopped by collision or another movement command. Values are not normalized, so (2, 0) moves twice as fast as (1, 0).

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The X component of the movement vector (negative for left, positive for right)

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: The Y component of the movement vector (negative for up, positive for down)

tasks.name: moveY1
tasks.description: Sets the task's actor to move one tile in the positive Y direction (down). The actor's movement vector is set directly, causing continuous movement until stopped by collision or another movement command.

tasks.name: moveYNeg1
tasks.description: Sets the task's actor to move one tile in the negative Y direction (up). The actor's movement vector is set directly, causing continuous movement until stopped by collision or another movement command.

tasks.name: mpos
tasks.description: Toggles the debug display of the mouse cursor position on screen. This is a development/debugging tool that shows the current mouse coordinates. Each execution toggles the display on or off.

tasks.name: nextDialogNode_hideWindow
tasks.description: Sets a flag that causes the dialog window to hide when advancing to the next dialog node. This is used to create seamless transitions where dialog disappears before showing the next node, often for dramatic effect or when switching to a different UI mode.

tasks.name: noSpeechFXLookOrAnim
tasks.description: A no-op task that performs no action. This appears to be a placeholder or disabled task type, possibly used for testing or as a marker in dialog sequences. The task completes immediately without side effects.

tasks.name: offerRest
tasks.description: Offers the player the option to rest at the current location, but only if in travel mode. First checks if the area is safe for resting - if not safe, displays a warning message. If safe, presents a confirmation dialog asking if the player wants to rest. Resting typically restores HP and advances time.

tasks.name: openCargo
tasks.description: Opens the cargo/inventory management interface. This displays the player's item storage and allows transferring items between party members, ships, or containers. The interface is opened via the UI input handler.

tasks.name: openFleetWindow_delay
tasks.description: Schedules the fleet window to open after a brief delay (0.1 seconds). This delayed opening allows other UI elements or animations to complete before showing the fleet interface, preventing visual conflicts or timing issues.

tasks.name: openFleetWindow
tasks.description: Opens the fleet management window showing the player's fleet of ships. This interface displays all ships owned by the player, their crews, cargo, and stats, allowing the player to manage their naval forces.

tasks.name: openFleetWindow_talker
tasks.description: Opens the fleet management window showing the fleet belonging to the task's actor. This allows viewing or managing another character's fleet, typically used when interacting with NPC fleet commanders or examining enemy fleets.

tasks.name: openJournal_interactive
tasks.description: Opens the journal to a specific entry page in interactive mode, allowing the player to navigate and interact with it. If the journal is already visible, it animates a page turn before displaying the new entry. Unlike openJournal, this version always keeps interactive buttons enabled.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The journal entry number to display (cast to integer)

tasks.name: openJournal
tasks.description: Opens the journal to a specific entry page. If the journal is already visible, it animates a page turn before displaying the new entry. The journal displays both the specified entry and related entries, and can optionally hide all interactive buttons to create a read-only display for cutscenes.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The journal entry number to display (cast to integer)

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, hides all interactive buttons on the journal, making it display-only

tasks.name: overseer
tasks.description: Switches the game to overseer mode, which is a special strategic view mode that allows top-down management of zones, actors, and game elements. This mode is typically used for zone editing, testing, or special gameplay sequences that require a bird's-eye perspective.

tasks.name: path
tasks.description: Calculates and assigns a movement path for a specified actor to reach a target tile coordinate. The actor will then follow this path automatically. Pathfinding can use either waypoint-based routing (which reverses the path) or standard AI pathfinding. Movement speed can optionally be customized.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The target tile coordinate to path to

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, uses waypoint-based pathfinding (path is reversed after calculation). If false, uses standard AI pathfinding.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the actor to path. If not provided or empty, uses the task's actorID.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The movement speed to set for the actor. If 0 or not provided, uses the actor's default speed.

tasks.name: pathParty
tasks.description: Calculates and assigns movement paths for all party members to reach a target tile coordinate. Each party member will pathfind independently from their current position to the target, then follow their calculated path automatically.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The target tile coordinate that all party members should path to

tasks.name: peace
tasks.description: Peacefully resolves combat with nearby enemies, ending hostilities and awarding experience points. All actors within 18 tiles of the same faction as the task's actor become non-hostile, stop targeting enemies, and have their dialog changed from 'auto' to 'auto_peaceful'. The party receives XP based on the power level of the enemy combat group (105% of power level  0.9).

tasks.name: peaceXPrewardOnly
tasks.description: Awards experience points to the party based on the task actor's combat group power level, without actually ending combat or changing enemy behavior. This is the 'reward only' version of the peace task, giving the same XP calculation (105% of power level  0.9) but leaving enemies in their current state.

tasks.name: p
tasks.description: Creates and loads a procedurally generated zone with a specified template name. The zone is given an ID prefixed with 'p_' and the player is moved to position (10, 10) in the new zone. Optionally prevents the 'entering via console' flag from being set, which affects zone initialization behavior.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The procedural zone template name to use for generation. The actual zone ID will be 'p_' + this name.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If false, prevents setting the 'entering via console' flag. If true or not provided, the flag is set (default behavior).

tasks.name: placeActorFromBoardedShip
tasks.description: Spawns a crew member of a specific actor type from a boarded ship's crew into the current zone at a designated travel point. The task searches the boarded ship's crew for actors matching the specified type and places the first match at the travel point position, then adds them to the active zone.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The actor type ID to search for in the boarded ship's crew (e.g., 'pirate', 'merchant')

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: The X and Y coordinates of the travel point where the crew member should be placed

tasks.name: playerAnim
tasks.description: Plays a specified animation on the player character. The animation is triggered immediately using the player actor's animator. Only executes if a player actor exists in the current zone.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The animation name/ID to play on the player character

tasks.name: playerFacingRot
tasks.description: Sets the player character's facing rotation to a specific angle and triggers a very brief delayed effect to update the visual facing. The rotation is applied immediately, and a timer triggers a 'facingRot' effect after 0.0001 seconds to ensure proper visual update.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The facing rotation angle in degrees to set for the player character

tasks.name: playerFlee
tasks.description: Allows the player to flee from combat by making all party members invisible and stopping nearby enemies from pursuing. All actors within 18 tiles of the same faction as the task's actor have their AI target cleared, their dialog reset (from 'auto' to empty), and are made to look at the player. Each party member receives increasing durations of invisibility (12s, 15s, 18s, etc.).

tasks.name: playerInitiateCombat
tasks.description: Forces the player to initiate combat with the task's actor. The game switches to travel mode, both the task's actor and player are set to idle animation, then the player character attacks the task's actor. The task's actorID is cleared after combat is initiated.

tasks.name: playerMoraleUp
tasks.description: Increases the morale actor value of all party members by 1 point, with a maximum value capped at 65. This provides a temporary boost to party morale without requiring any parameters.

tasks.name: playNearestLocationSong
tasks.description: Plays the external song associated with the nearest location to the player's current position. The location is determined by searching all locations (not just ports) and playing the song defined in that location's externalSong property.

tasks.name: playSong
tasks.description: Plays a specified song with customizable volume, pitch, delay, and override settings. Can play a custom song by ID, or special keywords like 'travelSong' or 'combatSong' to play the zone's travel or combat music. If no song is specified, stops all music. The song can override travel music changes and supports delayed playback.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Song ID to play. Special values: 'travelSong' or 'travel' plays the zone's travel song, 'combatSong' or 'combat' plays the zone's combat song. If empty or not provided, stops music

optional.name: tileCoords[0].X
optional.description: Volume percentage (0-100). The X coordinate is divided by 100 to get the volume value (e.g., 50 = 0.5 volume)

optional.name: tileCoords[0].Y
optional.description: Delay in seconds before the song starts playing. Use -99 if bools[1] is true to force immediate playback

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, the song will override travel music changes (prevents automatic travel music from stopping this song)

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Pitch adjustment for the song (0 = normal pitch, positive/negative values adjust pitch up/down)

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: If true, sets delay to -99 forcing immediate playback regardless of tileCoords[0].Y value

tasks.name: pointCameraAt
tasks.description: Points the camera at a specific tile coordinate or tracks an actor. When pointing at coordinates, it reveals fog of war at that location and can set custom camera tracking speed. Can optionally lock the camera to prevent player changes and apply a roof-like visual effect.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, prevents the camera from being changed by the player (locks camera control)

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: If true, fixes the camera as if the player is under a roof (applies visual darkening effect)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Tile coordinates to point the camera at. If provided, camera points at this fixed location and reveals fog of war there. If not provided, camera tracks an actor instead

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Camera tracking speed when pointing at coordinates. Only used if tileCoords[0] is provided and floats[0] is not 0

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Actor ID to track with the camera. Only used if tileCoords[0] is not provided. If this actor doesn't exist, falls back to the task's actorID or current actor

tasks.name: preventInteraction
tasks.description: Prevents player interaction for a specified duration by setting a delay timer. This is commonly used during cutscenes or scripted events to ensure the player cannot interfere with the sequence.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Duration in seconds to prevent player interaction

tasks.name: quietsave
tasks.description: Performs an autosave without any notification or player interaction. This ignores hardcore mode restrictions, allowing saves even when they would normally be disabled.

tasks.name: rankstyle
tasks.description: Toggles the visual display style for ranks between notches and an alternative representation. This affects how rank progression is shown in the UI.

tasks.name: reactOnMatchingItems
tasks.description: Searches the entire zone for items of a specified type and triggers reactions when matching items face each other on adjacent tiles. If the facing item is the same type, both react with the 'matchedSelf' element; if different types, they react with the 'matched' element. This is useful for puzzle mechanics involving item placement and orientation.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Item ID of the first item type to search for across the zone

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Item ID of the second item type that the first item should face. If empty or not provided, uses strings[0] (same item type). Items must be on adjacent tiles facing each other to trigger reactions

tasks.name: readdVendorToParty
tasks.description: Re-adds a vendor actor to the party if they are found at a specified travel point and have a matching dialog node ID. The actor's dialog node is cleared, they are added to the party and fleet, and repositioned near the player. This is used to restore vendors who were temporarily removed.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Travel point number where the vendor actor should be located (e.g., 0 for travel_point0)

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Dialog node ID that the actor must have to be re-added. This ensures only the correct vendor is affected

tasks.name: realtime
tasks.description: Toggles realtime mode on or off. Realtime mode affects game timing and behavior, switching between turn-based and real-time gameplay mechanics.

tasks.name: reassignQuestItem
tasks.description: Creates a new quest loot item, replaces its contents with a randomly selected quest item, and stores the new item's ID in the 'tavern_questItem' global variable. This is used to dynamically generate quest objectives.

tasks.name: recoverOverboardPartyActors
tasks.description: Recovers all party actors who went overboard by adding them back to the flagship's crew. Also removes any incapacitated or destroyed boats from the player's fleet. This is typically used after naval combat or when party members fell into water.

tasks.name: refreshloc
tasks.description: Adds any missing locations to the game world. This ensures all locations that should exist are present, typically used after new content is added or when locations need to be regenerated. Only works when not in the main menu zone.

tasks.name: refreshLocQuests
tasks.description: Refreshes the quest board at the current location by clearing all existing quests and generating new ones. This resets the available quests at the player's current location.

tasks.name: refreshRoyalQuests
tasks.description: Refreshes the available royal quests by generating new ones. This updates the special faction-based quest offerings from royal questgivers.

tasks.name: refreshRoyalTitle
tasks.description: Clears the player's royal title by setting the 'playerTitle' global variable to an empty string. This removes any earned title from the player.

tasks.name: refreshStatModifiers
tasks.description: Refreshes stat modifiers for all actors in the current zone. This recalculates and applies any stat bonuses or penalties from equipment, buffs, debuffs, or other sources affecting all actors.

tasks.name: refreshStatMods
tasks.description: Refreshes stat modifiers for all actors in the current zone, all party actors, and all actors in the barracks. This is a comprehensive refresh that recalculates stat bonuses/penalties across all relevant actor groups.

tasks.name: refreshUndamagedShipZones
tasks.description: Deletes saved zone data for all boats in the player's fleet, effectively resetting ship interiors to their undamaged state. This clears any damage or modifications to the internal zones of all fleet ships.

tasks.name: relocateActors
tasks.description: Relocates all actors within a specified radius of a center point to the outer edge of that radius. Actors matching an optional faction filter are moved to the nearest available tile outside the inner radius but within the outer boundary. Optionally plays a pain animation on relocated actors and clears party paths if party members are affected.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: Center tile coordinate from which actors will be relocated away

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Inner radius in tiles. Actors within this distance from the center are relocated. Defaults to 1 if not provided. Actors are moved to tiles outside this radius but within radius+3 tiles

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Faction filter. If provided, only actors of this faction are relocated. If empty, all actors in the radius are affected

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: If true, plays the 'pain' animation on each relocated actor

tasks.name: relocateActors_point
tasks.description: Relocates all actors within a specified radius of a center point to travel point markers. Actors matching an optional faction filter are placed on travel points of a specified set number. The placement can be restricted to unoccupied tiles only and randomized if desired.

required.name: tileCoords[0]
required.description: Center tile coordinate around which to search for actors to relocate

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, only places actors on unoccupied travel point tiles

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: If true, randomizes which travel point each actor is placed on (rather than placing them sequentially)

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Radius in tiles from the center point to search for actors. Defaults to 1 if not provided

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Faction filter. If provided, only actors of this faction are relocated. If empty, all actors in the radius are affected

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Travel point set number (e.g., '0' for travel_point0, '1' for travel_point1, etc.). Defaults to 0 if not provided

tasks.name: removeActorItem
tasks.description: Unequips and removes a specific item from an actor's inventory by item ID. The actor is specified by ID and the item is identified by its ID string.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Actor ID of the actor whose item will be removed

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Item ID to unequip and remove from the actor's inventory

tasks.name: removeActor
tasks.description: Removes an actor from the zone by ID or by tile coordinate. Can optionally play a visual effect at the actor's location and transfer their inventory to the player's stash before removal.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: If true, plays a visual effect at the actor's position before removal. Defaults to 'actor_flee' effect unless strings[1] specifies a different effect

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: If true, transfers all items from the actor's inventory to the player's stash before removing the actor

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Actor ID to remove. Only used if tileCoords[0] is not provided
