Identical to spawn_actorPrefab, but when spawning a prefab, the tileCoords determine which travel point to use for positioning and rotation. For spawn data, behaves the same as spawn_actorPrefab.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Actor prefab ID or spawn data ID to spawn

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: For prefabs: facing rotation (overridden by travel point rotation). For spawn data: power level adjustment added to party power level

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: For prefabs: whether to use the prefab ID as the actor's ID. For spawn data: whether actors should face the center point of the spawn area

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: For prefabs: animation ID to play after spawning. For spawn data: group ID override (defaults to spawn data ID)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Travel point coordinates (X and Y used to determine which travel point); if not provided for spawn data, spawns at random location

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: For spawn data: whether spawned actors should look at the player

tasks.name: spawn_actorPrefab_point_specialZone
tasks.description: Spawns an actor prefab in the special zone at a specific travel point from a travel point set. The actor is positioned and rotated according to the travel point, fully healed, and all effects cleared. Only works when a special zone exists and the prefab is valid.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Actor prefab ID to spawn

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to use the prefab ID as the spawned actor's ID

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Animation ID to play after spawning

optional.name: tileCoords[0].X
optional.description: Index of which travel point to use from the travel point set (0-based)

optional.name: tileCoords[0].Y
optional.description: Travel point set identifier (used with value 0 to get the travel point set)

tasks.name: spawn_corpse
tasks.description: Spawns a random corpse from the party's dead actors list, tracking which corpses have been spawned using global variables 'spawnedCorpse1' and 'spawnedCorpse2'. Only spawns if there are corpses available and fewer than 2 have already been spawned. Avoids spawning the same corpse twice.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Specific tile coordinate to spawn the corpse at; if not provided (X=-1), spawns at the center of the trigger area

tasks.name: spawn_fleet
tasks.description: Spawns a fleet at a specified location using spawn data. Creates a fleet with merchant and elite status flags, faction override from spawn data, and power level adjustment. The fleet does not use standard AI behavior.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Spawn data ID to use for creating the fleet

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether the fleet is a merchant fleet

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether the fleet is an elite fleet

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Power level for the fleet

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Additional spawn parameter (passed to fleet spawn function)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Tile coordinate where the fleet should spawn

tasks.name: spawn_g
tasks.description: Spawns actors using a spawn data ID stored in a global variable. Retrieves the spawn data ID from the specified global variable and executes a spawn task with the retrieved ID. Allows dynamic spawning based on saved game state.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Global variable name containing the spawn data ID to use

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Power level adjustment added to party power level

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether actors should face the center point of the spawn area

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether spawned actors should look at the player

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Group ID override (defaults to spawn data ID)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Specific tile coordinate to spawn at; if not provided, spawns at random location within trigger area

tasks.name: spawn_g_nearPlayer
tasks.description: Spawns actors near the player using a spawn data ID stored in a global variable. Retrieves the spawn data ID from the specified global variable and executes a spawn task in a 3x3 area around the player's position. If bools[1] is true, spawns behind the player instead of at their position.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Global variable name containing the spawn data ID to use

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Power level adjustment added to party power level

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether actors should face the center point of the spawn area

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether to spawn behind the player (3 tiles in opposite direction of facing)

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Group ID override (defaults to spawn data ID)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Additional spawn parameters (passed to spawn task but origin is always near player)

tasks.name: spawnItem
tasks.description: Spawns an item on the ground at a specified location or randomly within the trigger area. Can spawn items by ID or from a global variable containing an item ID. Optionally shows a visual effect when the item appears and can use travel points for positioning.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Item type ID to spawn, or global variable name containing the item type ID if the ID doesn't exist in item types

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to show the item with a visual pop effect when spawned

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Quantity of items to spawn (defaults to 1 if not provided or if <= 0)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Specific tile coordinate to spawn at; if not provided, spawns at random occupiable location within trigger area

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: Whether to use tileCoords as a travel point reference instead of direct coordinates

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Visual effect ID to play at the spawn location (in white color)

tasks.name: spawn
tasks.description: Spawns an actor from a prefab or spawn data within the trigger area. If spawning a prefab, creates a single actor with specified facing rotation and optional animation. If spawning from spawn data, creates a group of enemies with power level adjustments, positioning them within the specified area or at specific coordinates. Actors face toward the center or player depending on bools settings. Functionally identical to spawn_actorPrefab.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Actor prefab ID or spawn data ID to spawn

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: For prefabs: facing rotation in degrees. For spawn data: power level adjustment added to party power level

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: For prefabs: whether to use the prefab ID as the actor's ID. For spawn data: whether actors should face the center point of the spawn area

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: For prefabs: animation ID to play after spawning. For spawn data: group ID override (defaults to spawn data ID)

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Specific tile coordinate to spawn at; if not provided, spawns at random location within trigger area

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: For spawn data: whether spawned actors should look at the player

tasks.name: spawn_location
tasks.description: Spawns NPCs from the current location's auto-spawn data list. The number of spawn groups increases with location wealth (1 group normally, 2 if wealth > 60, 3 if wealth > 999). Randomly selects spawn data from the location's list, creates actors, and places them on travel points. Also applies special player port spawns if the player owns a home.

tasks.name: subtract300gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 300 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract30gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 30 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract350gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 350 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract400gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 400 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract40gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 40 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract5000gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 5000 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract500gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 500 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract50gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 50 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract60gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 60 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract75gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 75 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtract800gp
tasks.description: Subtracts 800 gold pieces from the player's money. This is a fixed amount deduction commonly used for specific quest costs or purchases.

tasks.name: subtractAllgp
tasks.description: Sets the player's money to zero, effectively removing all gold pieces. This completely empties the player's wallet.

tasks.name: subtractBribeAmount
tasks.description: Calculates a bribe amount based on the actor's combat group power level (14% of power level), subtracts that amount from the player's money, and gives the gold to the actor's inventory. This is used for bribery mechanics where the cost is dynamically calculated.

tasks.name: subtractgp
tasks.description: Subtracts a variable amount of gold pieces from the player's money. The amount can be specified either as a formula string or as a numeric value. The formula is calculated and floored to an integer before subtraction.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Formula string to calculate the amount of gold to subtract. Used if provided, otherwise floats[0] is used

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Numeric amount of gold to subtract. Only used if strings is empty

tasks.name: talk
tasks.description: Initiates a conversation with an actor or displays a dialog node with no actor. If the actor ID is empty or invalid, it shows a dialog without an NPC. Otherwise, it starts a conversation with the specified actor using the given dialog node.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Actor ID to talk to. If empty or the actor doesn't exist, displays dialog without an NPC

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Dialog node ID to display or start the conversation with

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to disable camera pointing between player and NPC (inverted: false means camera points, true means it doesn't)

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether to position the dialog at the bottom of the screen instead of using tileCoords Y position

tasks.name: talkToCommodore
tasks.description: Initiates a conversation with the commodore of the actor's fleet. This retrieves the commodore's ID from the fleet and starts a dialog with them if not already talking to them.

tasks.name: talkToFirstMate
tasks.description: Initiates a conversation with the first mate of the player's crew. This retrieves the first mate's ID from the global variable 'firstmate' and starts a dialog with them if not already talking to them.

tasks.name: talkToFlagship
tasks.description: Initiates a conversation with the flagship of the actor's fleet. If the fleet has no faction, it shows silent dialog. Special handling for the 'lagan' commodore converts them to a pirate faction. Otherwise, it talks to the flagship actor using the current dialog node.

tasks.name: talkToOtherActor
tasks.description: Initiates a conversation with another actor at the same tile position as the task's actor. It prioritizes non-incapacitated actors and excludes the task's own actor ID when searching for someone to talk to.

tasks.name: task_gvar
tasks.description: Executes a task whose type is stored in a global variable. The global variable name is specified, and if its value is not '0', a new task is created with that type and executed immediately.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Name of the global variable containing the task type to execute

tasks.name: tc
tasks.description: Toggles combat mode on or off globally. This is a debug/testing task that enables or disables the combat system and displays a debug message showing the current state.

tasks.name: tcui
tasks.description: Toggles the visibility of the combat UI. This is a debug/testing task that shows or hides all combat interface elements.

tasks.name: tdm
tasks.description: Toggles the display of damage numbers. This is a debug/testing task that shows or hides floating damage numbers during combat.

tasks.name: test2
tasks.description: An empty test task that does nothing. This appears to be a placeholder or dummy task used for development testing purposes.

tasks.name: testboatanim
tasks.description: Returns to the previous input mode and triggers boarding special zone timers. This is a debug/testing task for testing boat animations and boarding sequences.

tasks.name: testitemload
tasks.description: A debug task that spawns items on every tile in the current zone. By default it spawns 'toyboat' items, but can be configured to spawn any item type. This is used for testing item loading and rendering performance.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Item ID to spawn on every tile. Defaults to 'toyboat' if not provided

tasks.name: test
tasks.description: A debug test task that performs regex replacement on formula strings. It schedules a 'test2' task to run after 1 second, then demonstrates replacing 'd:sword' with 'beans' in a test string and displays the result.

tasks.name: testskillcost
tasks.description: A debug task that calculates and displays skill costs using a formula. It requires three values (base, increment, multiplier) and computes costs for 12 levels using the formula: (base + level * increment) * multiplier^level. The results are displayed as a comma-separated list.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Base cost value for the skill

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: Increment value added per level

required.name: floats[2]
required.description: Multiplier raised to the power of the level

tasks.name: testzones
tasks.description: A debug task that automatically travels through all zone files not in the level data dictionary. It filters out special zones (sp, grove, den, bz prefixes) and creates a series of travel_point tasks to visit each zone, displaying progress as damage numbers. This is used for testing zone loading.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Maximum number of zones to test in a single run. If not provided, tests all zones

optional.name: floats[1]
optional.description: Number of times to repeat the entire test sequence. Defaults to 1 if not provided

tasks.name: textOverlay_dynamic
tasks.description: Displays an overlay text message with dynamic character-by-character reveal animation. The text appears gradually with customizable positioning and transparency. X and Y offsets default to 0 if not provided via tileCoords.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Text message to display in the overlay with dynamic reveal

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Alpha color value (0-255) for text transparency

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to disable horizontal centering (inverted: false centers the text, true doesn't)

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether to disable vertical centering (inverted: false centers the text, true doesn't)

tasks.name: textOverlay
tasks.description: Displays an overlay text message on the screen with customizable positioning and transparency. The text can be centered or offset, and supports alpha transparency. The Y offset is always set to 0 regardless of input.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to disable horizontal centering (inverted: false centers the text, true doesn't)

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether to disable vertical centering (inverted: false centers the text, true doesn't)

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Text message to display in the overlay. Defaults to empty string if not provided

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Alpha color value (0-255) for text transparency. Defaults to 0 (fully transparent) if not provided

tasks.name: textOverlay_tween
tasks.description: Displays an overlay text message with a smooth tween animation. The text animates onto the screen with customizable positioning and transparency. X and Y offsets default to 0 if not provided via tileCoords.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Text message to display in the overlay with tween animation. Defaults to empty string if not provided

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Alpha color value (0-255) for text transparency. Defaults to 0 (fully transparent) if not provided

tasks.name: tfl
tasks.description: Toggles the FPS (frames per second) limit on or off. This is a debug/testing task that enables or disables the frame rate cap, useful for performance testing.

tasks.name: time
tasks.description: Advances the in-game world time by a specified amount. This adds the given value to the world time and refreshes the travel info window to reflect the time change.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Amount of time to add to the world time

tasks.name: timeSpeed
tasks.description: Sets the game's time speed multiplier. This controls how fast time passes in the game, with values like 1.0 for normal speed, 2.0 for double speed, 0.5 for half speed, etc.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Time speed multiplier value to set

tasks.name: tMapTest
tasks.description: A debug task that generates map screenshots of special zones in a grid pattern. It loads the 'eral' special zone, clears actors and certain items, then recursively takes 32x32 tile screenshots starting at a given position, moving right and wrapping down when reaching x=700. Used for generating map tiles.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Starting X coordinate for the screenshot. Defaults to 100 if not provided

optional.name: floats[1]
optional.description: Starting Y coordinate for the screenshot. Defaults to 100 if not provided

tasks.name: tm
tasks.description: Toggles the visibility of game menus. This is a debug/testing task that shows or hides all menu interface elements.

tasks.name: togglePause
tasks.description: Toggles the pause state of actors and actions in the game. When paused, all actor movement and actions are frozen. When unpaused, they resume normally.

tasks.name: tq
tasks.description: Toggles the visibility of quick slots and character stats UI. This is a debug/testing task that shows or hides the quick slot bar and character statistics display.

tasks.name: travel_g
tasks.description: Travels to a zone specified by the global variable 'lastProcZoneEntry'. If in combat, asks about fleeing. Otherwise, autosaves and moves to the zone retrieved from the global variable with the specified fade duration.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Fade duration in seconds for the transition

tasks.name: travel_gVars
tasks.description: Travels to a zone and position specified by global variables. Uses 'playerPrevZone' for the zone ID and 'playerX'/'playerY' for coordinates. If in combat, asks about fleeing. Otherwise, travels to the stored location with autosave unless disabled.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Fade duration in seconds for the transition

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to disable autosaving before travel (inverted: false allows autosave, true prevents it)

tasks.name: travel
tasks.description: Travels to a specified zone with optional coordinates and fade duration. If currently in combat mode, it asks about fleeing instead. If in action mode, the travel is prevented. Otherwise, it initiates travel to the target zone with autosave unless disabled.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Zone ID to travel to

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Fade duration in seconds for the transition

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to disable autosaving before travel (inverted: false allows autosave, true prevents it)

tasks.name: travel_leaveLocation
tasks.description: Exits the current location and returns to the overworld or previous zone. If in combat, asks about fleeing. The return coordinates can be specified via tileCoords, or default to (0,0) if not provided and autosave is disabled.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Whether coordinates are provided (true means tileCoords specify return position, false uses default)

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: Whether to disable autosaving when leaving (inverted: false allows autosave, true prevents it)

tasks.name: travel_noSave
tasks.description: Travels to a specified zone without autosaving. If in combat, asks about fleeing. Otherwise, it directly moves to the new zone with the specified fade duration, bypassing the normal autosave mechanism.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Zone ID to travel to

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Fade duration in seconds for the transition

tasks.name: travel_point_g
tasks.description: Travels to a specific point within a zone, where the zone ID is retrieved from a global variable. Uses special coordinate format (-99, pointID) for point-based travel. If in combat, asks about fleeing. Supports optional autosave disabling and console entry mode.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Name of the global variable containing the zone ID to travel to

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Point ID number within the zone to travel to

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Whether to disable autosaving before travel (inverted: false allows autosave, true prevents it)

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: Whether to mark this as entering via console (enables special console entry mode if true)

tasks.name: travel_point
tasks.description: Travels to a specific point ID within a zone. Uses a special coordinate format (-99, pointID) to indicate point-based travel. If in combat, asks about fleeing. Supports optional autosave disabling and console entry mode.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Zone ID to travel to

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Point ID number within the zone to travel to

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Whether to disable autosaving before travel (inverted: false allows autosave, true prevents it)

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: Whether to mark this as entering via console (enables special console entry mode if true)

tasks.name: travel_procedural
tasks.description: Creates and travels to a procedurally generated world/dungeon. The world type and destination are specified, with optional return coordinates. The destination can include a comma-separated bottom exit override. Return coordinates can come from tileCoords or be centered on the trigger area.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Procedural world type/template to generate

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: End destination zone (and optional bottom exit override, comma-separated)

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to disable autosaving (inverted: false allows autosave, true prevents it)

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether to use centered trigger area coordinates as return position instead of tileCoords

tasks.name: travel_procedural_point
tasks.description: Creates and travels to a procedurally generated world at a specific point. Similar to travel_procedural but also accepts a point ID for the destination. The world type and destination are specified, with optional return coordinates and bottom exit override.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Procedural world type/template to generate

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: End destination zone (and optional bottom exit override, comma-separated)

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Point ID number within the destination zone

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to disable autosaving (inverted: false allows autosave, true prevents it)

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether to use centered trigger area coordinates as return position instead of tileCoords

tasks.name: travel_setReturnPath
tasks.description: Travels to a zone while setting a return path for later use. If in combat, asks about fleeing. Otherwise, autosaves and moves to the zone, storing the return coordinates either from tileCoords or centered on the trigger area for future return travel.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Zone ID to travel to

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Fade duration in seconds for the transition

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to use centered trigger area coordinates as return position instead of tileCoords

tasks.name: triggerEffect
tasks.description: Schedules a trigger effect to execute after a delay. This task has two modes: a simple mode that takes a delay and effect name, or an extended mode with multiple timing and parameter configurations. The extended mode allows specifying effect names, delays, and additional parameters for more complex trigger effect timing.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: In simple mode (when strings.Count <= 5): delay in seconds before executing the trigger effect. In extended mode: first timing parameter parsed from strings[0]

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: In simple mode: the trigger effect name/ID to execute. In extended mode: first timing value as string (converted to float)

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Extended mode only: the trigger effect name/ID to execute

optional.name: strings[2]
optional.description: Extended mode only: second timing parameter as string (converted to float)

optional.name: strings[3]
optional.description: Extended mode only: additional parameter for the trigger effect

optional.name: strings[4]
optional.description: Extended mode only: third timing parameter as string (converted to float)

tasks.name: trigger
tasks.description: Executes a trigger by ID, index, or from global triggers. Optionally evaluates a formula condition before execution. Can bypass trigger requirement checks and consumable/dialog checks. Supports both zone-local and global triggers.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Trigger ID to execute. Searches zone triggers first, then global triggers. If empty, uses floats[0] as index

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Optional formula condition that must evaluate to greater than 0 for the trigger to execute

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Trigger index in the zone's trigger list. Only used if strings[0] is empty

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Whether to bypass trigger requirement checks (true skips checkIfCanTrigger)

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: Whether to skip consumable and dialog checks within checkIfCanTrigger (inverted: false checks, true skips)

tasks.name: tryDialog_commodore
tasks.description: Attempts to start a dialog with the specified ID and if successful, points the camera at the enemy flagship (commodore) with a special effect. This is used for naval encounters where the enemy commodore initiates dialog. An exclamation visual effect is added to the flagship position.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog ID to attempt to start

tasks.name: tryDialog
tasks.description: Attempts to start a dialog with the specified ID. If successful and a tile coordinate is provided, the camera will point to that location with a fixed view. This is used for triggering story dialogs or NPC conversations.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog ID to attempt to start

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate to point the camera at if the dialog starts successfully

tasks.name: trySetAchievement
tasks.description: Sets a global variable and attempts to unlock a Steam achievement with the specified ID. The global variable is set to 1.0 without triggering achievement checks (to prevent recursion), and then the Steam API is called if available to unlock the achievement and store stats.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The achievement ID to unlock (also used as the global variable name)

tasks.name: tt
tasks.description: Toggles the display of tooltips in the game UI. This is a debug/developer command that switches between showing and hiding tooltips globally.

tasks.name: tw
tasks.description: Toggles the display of debug wires in the camera view. This is a debug/developer command that shows or hides visual debug information like collision boundaries or pathfinding data.

tasks.name: UIPartInputCommand
tasks.description: Handles UI part input commands with optional parameters. This task has two modes: a simple mode that takes only an action string, or an extended mode that includes additional parameters for more complex UI interactions. The extended mode is used when sufficient parameters are provided (at least 3 strings and 2 floats).

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The action/command to execute on the UI part

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Extended mode only: the name parameter for the UI command

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Extended mode only: the ID number parameter for the UI command

optional.name: strings[2]
optional.description: Extended mode only: the value parameter for the UI command

optional.name: floats[1]
optional.description: Extended mode only: the float value parameter for the UI command

tasks.name: unlockExtras
tasks.description: Unlocks extra game features including bonus races/actor types and extra options. This adds all player-unlockable actor types to the available pool, sets unlock flags, triggers a completion achievement, and saves the configuration to disk. This is typically used for game progression milestones or rewards.

tasks.name: unlockGem
tasks.description: Unlocks and enables the help gem feature for the player. If this is the first time unlocking, visual effects (super sparkles and a positive aura sound) are played at the player's position. The gem becomes immediately usable with no cooldown timer.

tasks.name: unlockHelpGem
tasks.description: Unlocks and enables the help gem feature for the player without visual effects. The gem becomes immediately usable with no cooldown timer. This is a simpler version of the unlockGem task.

tasks.name: uploadmod
tasks.description: Uploads a mod to the Steam Workshop. This validates the specified mod folder, initiates the Steam Workshop item creation process, and displays a progress dialog to the user. Player interaction is prevented during the upload process.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the mod folder to upload to Steam Workshop

tasks.name: weather
tasks.description: Sets the current weather to the specified weather type. This changes the global weather state which affects visuals, gameplay mechanics, and environmental effects.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The weather type name to set. Must be one of: none, rain, storm, snow, gale, krill

tasks.name: wind
tasks.description: Sets the wind rotation/direction to the specified angle. This affects sailing mechanics and wind-based gameplay elements.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The wind rotation angle in degrees

tasks.name: win
tasks.description: Immediately ends the current combat encounter as a victory. This forces the combat to end with the player victorious (not fleeing) regardless of the current combat state.

tasks.name: w
tasks.description: Creates and enters a procedural world with the specified level data ID. This is an alias for the 'world' task. The game validates that the level data exists, generates the procedural world, and loads the starting zone at coordinates 0,0 with the player spawning at tile position (12, 12).

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The level data ID to use for generating the procedural world (must exist in Data.levelData)

tasks.name: world
tasks.description: Creates and enters a procedural world with the specified level data ID. The game validates that the level data exists, generates the procedural world, and loads the starting zone at coordinates 0,0 with the player spawning at tile position (12, 12).

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The level data ID to use for generating the procedural world (must exist in Data.levelData)

tasks.name: xpall
tasks.description: Awards experience points to all party members for all selectable classes. This is a debug/cheat command that grants XP across every available class for every party actor. If no amount is specified, defaults to 9999 XP.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The amount of XP to award to each class for each party member (defaults to 9999 if not specified)

tasks.name: xpcost
tasks.description: Debug command that calculates and displays the total XP cost for all actions in each selectable actor class. This sums up all XP costs for all actions available to each class and outputs the results for debugging or balancing purposes.

tasks.name: xpcosts
tasks.description: Debug command that calculates and displays the total XP cost for all actions in each selectable actor class. This sums up all XP costs for all actions available to each class and outputs the results for debugging or balancing purposes. This is an alias for the 'xpcost' task.

tasks.name: xp
tasks.description: Awards experience points to all party members for their current/default class. This is a debug/cheat command that grants XP to every party actor. If no amount is specified, defaults to 9999 XP.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The amount of XP to award to each party member (defaults to 9999 if not specified)

tasks.name: z
tasks.description: Debug command that lists all zone PNG files in the ZoneData directory that don't match existing level data keys. This helps identify orphaned or custom zone files. Can optionally filter results to only show zones starting with 'z' followed by a specific string.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: Optional filter string - if provided, only shows zone files starting with 'z' followed by this string (case-insensitive)
